intro: Hydrocharella, commonly known as water shield, is a genus of aquatic plants belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. These plants are characterized by their floating leaves and root systems that anchor them in shallow water. They often grow in still or slow-moving freshwater environments such as ponds and lakes. Hydrocharella species typically have small, inconspicuous flowers that are adapted for pollination by water insects. Their presence is an indicator of good water quality and healthy aquatic ecosystems.
